RelationshipElement.name: Transect - Orbit
RelationshipElement.description: A 1-to-n relationship between the parent and its children, respectively.

RelationshipElement.name: Transect - Unit
RelationshipElement.description: A 1-to-n relationship between the parent and its children, respectively.

RelationshipElement.name: Unit - Row
RelationshipElement.description: A 1-to-n relationship between the parent and its children, respectively.

property.name: Planet Name
property.description: Official name of the planet as it appears in the game (or as it is called by its indigenous population).

property.name: StartTimestamp
property.description: Tap the Record Start Timestamp button to make the date and time to appear.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Planet Nickname
property.description: Surveyor-assigned name for record-keeping purposes in the format of Surname-PlanetNumber.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Transect author
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Geotag
property.description: Alphanumeric, recording the precise location of the planet being surveyed.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Number Of Orbits
property.description: Records how many orbits were completed of this planet by the surveyor.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Survey Method
property.description: Choose either “Orbital” or “Suborbital”.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Predominant Surface Type
property.description: Describes the predominant surface composition.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Number of Features
property.description: Enter the number of archaeological points of interest observed during planetary orbits.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Location and description
property.description: Free-text to describe generally the planet being surveyed. This could include access, relation to other planets/transects/systems, land use etc.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Area Surveyed
property.description: Numeric size of area surveyed, in square kilometers. Can be approximate.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Bearing
property.description: Compass heading in the direction of travel for the transect.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: From Direction
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: To Direction
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Comment on transect
property.description: Free-text description about the nature and reason for conducting the transect. This could include identifying "other" macro-artefacts, built environments, glitches, explanation of field procedures, etc.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Video Capture URL
property.description: Record the link to video captured by the surveyor on Twitch, YouTube, etc.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Screengrab Filename
property.description: Name of the file of a screenshot taken while completing the transect for future reference. Format for filenames: Surname-PlanetNumber-IncrementalNumber.filetype.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Attach a Screengrab
property.description: Tap the “Attach File” button to upload the screenshot to the FAIMS NMSAS server. Works only on Android devices. If you are using an emulator, please follow instructions for uploading screenshots using the FAIMS web server.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Dominant Planet Coverage
property.description: Check as many as apply. Use annotation on "other" to identify any other planet coverage.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Percentage of Visable Surface
property.description: Percentage of surface visiable from orbiting altitude. If you can see the planet’s surface without any obstruction from atmosphere or cloud, enter 100.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Comment on planetary coverage
property.description: Any general comments on planetary coverage that do not meaningfully 'fit' as simple annotations of the checkbox options.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Comment on surface conditions
property.description: Comments on surface conditions, glitches or unintended game behaviour, etc. For future visitors, note the difficulty of surface travel for walking or for vehicles.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Features
property.description: Note any outstanding features on the planet (e.g., Jupiter’s Great Red Spot).
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Revisit
property.description: Indicate if the planet merits a return visit by archaeologists and if so, why.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Revisit Reason
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: EndTimestamp
property.description: Tap this button after completing the survey prior to visiting the next unit.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Orbit Number
property.description: Enter the cardinal number for your orbit of the planet (e.g., 1, 2, 3, etc.).
property.formatString: - Orbit $2

property.name: Agriculture
property.description: Count any agricultural areas spotted on the flyover (e.g., fields). Annotate as needed.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Architecture
property.description: Count any architectural features spotted on the flyover (e.g., houses, temples). Annotate as needed.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Settlement
property.description: Count any settlements encountered on the walkthrough. Annotate as needed.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Other
property.description: Count any other items encountered on the walkthrough. Annotate.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Journal Entry Number
property.formatString: Journal Entry $2

property.name: StartTimestamp
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Journal
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}
